refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Traydevice configuration file is a xml defined by @XSD_PATH@. This configuration sets up a menu containing entries that get dynamically enabled or disabled using conditions quering UDisks device properties. For complete description of device properties see udisks manual.
Configuration consists of iconmap and multiple menuentry.

refsect2.title: iconmap
refsect2.para: Defines which icon should be displayed in systray. First matching icon is used. It is constructed from several icon elements, containing displayed_if condition and a tooltip setting.

icon element has attribute
icon
The reference to displayed image. Accepted values for this attribute are either stockitems(prefixed by "gtk.") or absolute filenames of png icons.
displayed_if element is a generic condition. Conditions are explained in separate section of this manual.
tooltip is regular command, whose standard output will be used as tooltip.

refsect2.title: menuentry
refsect2.para: menuentry defines a single entry in the traydevice right click menu. It is constructed from the enabled_if condition and several command elements.

menuentry element has attributes:
icon
The reference to displayed image in menu. Accepted values for this attribute are either stockitems(prefixed by "gtk.") or absolute filenames of png icons.
text
A text that should be displayed at this menu entry.
enabled_if element is a generic condition. Conditions are explained in separate section of this manual.

command element specifies a command to be executed. It has single attribute:
executable
The name of the command to be executed.
And any number of parameters can be passed using nested elements:
arg
A constant argument.
ref
A reference to device property.

refsect2.title: conditions
refsect2.para: Conditions are expressions evaluating whether particular device properties have expected values. Logical operators (NOT, OR, AND) can be used to construct complex conditions.

Simple condition is created using match element with attributes:
key
A reference to device property.
string(optional)
match a string property; for example <match key="foo.bar" string="baz"> will match only if 'foo.bar' is a string property assuming the value 'baz'.
int(optional)
match an integer property;
bool(optional)
match an boolean property;

Simple conditions can be joined together using logical operators - elements or,not,and. For example:
<displayed_if> <and> <match property="foo.bar" int="5"/> <or> <match property="foo.balls" int="1"/> <match property="foo.balls" int="2"/> </or> <not> <match property="foo.frog" boolean="true"/> </not> </and> </displayed_if> Will display the icon if foo.bar has value 5, foo.bals has value 1 or 2 and foo.frog is not equal to true.

refsect1.title: Bugs
refsect1.para: Using filenames as icons is not yet implemented.
